noteParagraph.text: A method of manufacturing footwear is covered by the group designating the machine or tool for the manufacture unless the method is independent of a distinct machine or tool. If the method does not involve the use of a distinct machine or tool the invention is classified in the relevant group of sub-class .

titlePart.entryReference: measuring specific parts of the human body in general

titlePart.text: Measuring devices for the inside measure of shoes, for the height of heels, or for the arrangement of heels
Lasts for making or repairing shoes
Devices for stretching special parts of shoes
Devices for inserting or reinserting lasts
Devices for maintaining the shape of the shoe
Hand appliances or hand tools for making or repairing shoes, other than those covered by groups , , , ,
Tools for cutting off the ends of nails or pegs in shoes
Machines for cutting, ornamenting, marking or otherwise working up shoe part blanks
titlePart.entryReference: making or fastening soles, heels or welts

titlePart.text: Combined stamping-out and bonding, e.g. high frequency electric current being applied between cutting edge and work support

titlePart.entryReference: printing per se, stamping per se

titlePart.text: Embossing using heat, e.g. high frequency electric current

titlePart.entryReference: printing per se, stamping per se

titlePart.text: Charting sheet material for subsequent cutting
by trimming the margins of sole blanks

titlePart.text: by folding, turning in or over, hammering
Combined splitting and trimming of the heel-seat portions of sole blanks
titlePart.entryReference: of soles fixed to shoe bottoms

titlePart.text: Devices for binding the uppers upon the lasts
Machines for preliminary treatment or assembling of upper-parts, counters, or insoles on their lasts preparatory to the pulling-over or lasting operations
Machines for applying or securing reinforcements or ornamental straps to uppers
Coating with thermoplastic materials to stiffen the toe or heel portion
Machines for seam-pressing or flattening shoe parts, quarters, etc.
Machines for temporary buttoning of shoe parts
Machines for temporary lacing of shoe parts or for cutting-away the lacing strips after lasting
Devices for holding the lacing portions in position during lasting
Machines for forming the toe part or heel part of shoes, with or without use of heat
Devices for treating shoe parts, e.g. stiffeners, with steam or liquid
Machines for pulling-over the uppers when loosely laid upon the last and tacking the toe end
Devices for locating caps or stiffeners on pulling-over machines
Pulling-over or lasting machines for binding the toe end with cord, string, or wire
Lasting machines with sewing devices, also for platform shoes
titlePart.entryReference: special sewing machines for leather or shoes

titlePart.text: Pulling-over or lasting machines with oscillating shoe supports
Tacking or nailing devices for use with lasting pincers
for lasting the opposite sides of the shoe one after another
with last supports and toe- or heel-embracing wipers movable both horizontally and vertically
with lasting clamps, shoe-shaped clamps, wipers, stretching straps, or the like for forming the toe or heel parts on the last
for toe or heel parts, with nailing devices
with lasting pincers or toe- or heel-embracing wipers
with lasting pincers and straight-acting wipers, also for forming the shank portions of shoes
Single parts for pulling-over or lasting machines
Devices for cutting-off superfluous material on the uppers or linings
Making or fastening soles, heels, or welts, or preparing same for fastening to the shoe
Carrying out other operations subsequent to lasting
Devices for lasting with adhesives or for gluing together insoles and uppers
Devices for gluing soles on shoe bottoms
Press-pads or other supports of shoe-gluing presses
Devices for gluing heel-breasts to heels or for glueing coverings on heels
Devices for filling the shoe bottom
Devices for making glued platform shoes
Devices for applying adhesives to shoe parts
titlePart.entryReference: applying liquids or other fluent materials to surfaces in general

titlePart.text: Arrangements for activating or for accelerating setting of adhesives, e.g. by using heat
Machines for trimming as an intermediate operation

trimming as a finishing operation in shoemaking

for nailing or stapling the lasted margin on to shoes with wooden soles
